Text: Morishima Chūryō (森島 中良 , 1756 – December 29, 1810) was an Edo period Japanese author of popular fiction who also wrote a number of works in the field of rangaku (Western studies).
Triplets:<Morishima Chūryō
1:
--------------------
Text: Morishima Chūryō:  He wrote under many pen names, including Manzōtei, Shinra Manzō (or, conventionally, Shinra Banshō), and Tenjiku Rōjin ("old man from India").
Triplets:<Morishima Chūryō
2:
--------------------
Text: Morishima Chūryō:  The latter constituted an allusion to the pen name Tenjiku Rōnin ("masterless samurai from India"), used by Hiraga Gennai, to whom Chūryō was the principal literary successor.
Triplets:<Morishima Chūryō

ere are the extracted triplets:

Morishima Chūryō
5:
--------------------
<Text: Morishima Chūryō:  Chūryō was the younger brother of Katsuragawa Hoshū, a shogunal physician and leading scholar of rangaku.>
